data.name: CreateAutoSpnFooter
data.value:
A new Azure service principal will be created and assigned with "Contributor" role, having access to all resources within the subscription. Optionally, you can select the Resource Group to which you want to limit access.

If your subscription is not listed above, or your organization is not backed by Microsoft Entra, or to specify an existing service principal,

data.name: NoMatchingSubscriptionFound
data.value: No matching subscription or service connection was found

data.name: RunOnServerTaskTypeDescription
data.value: Tasks are shown that will run on the server. Currently, only one task can be added to a server job.

data.value: To run as a LaunchAgent service see here

data.value: The subscription ID must be a valid GUID

data.name: NoGenericConnectionFound
data.value: No generic service connection was found

data.name: AzureRMEndpointHelpText
data.value:
Select the Azure service connection to deploy. To configure a new service connection, select the Azure subscription from the list and click 'Authorize'.
Note: If your subscription is not listed or if you want to use an existing service principal, you can set up an Azure service connection using the 'Add' or 'Manage' link.

data.name: ServiceConnectionDefaultAuthText
data.value: Allow all pipelines to use this connection.

data.name: MetataskControlOptionsTooltipText
data.value: Setting the control option as 'false' in the task group will override the control option value in the sub-tasks. Otherwise, it honors the value set in sub-tasks. [Read more](https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=761053).

data.name: VerifyServiceEndpointFailureSuggestion
data.value: Note: Verification may fail if the URL is not accessible from {0}. However, it might still be valid and accessible from the agent that executes the build or release.

data.name: KubernetesAzureSubscriptionHelpText
data.value: Select Azure subscription to list clusters. Only Azure Cloud subscriptions are listed in the dropdown.

data.value: The ca.cert content if the Kubernetes API is using a TLS certificate. Use the ‘kubectl get serviceaccounts <service-account-name> -o yaml’ and ‘kubectl get secret <service-account-secret-name> -o yaml’ commands to get the ca.cert content.

data.value: For help on creating an Azure service principal, see service connections.

data.name: TaskTimeoutTooltip
data.value:
Specifies the maximum time, in minutes, that a task is allowed to execute on the agent before being canceled by the server.
A zero value indicates an infinite timeout.

data.name: AuthorizeToCreateAzureRMEndpointHelpText
data.value: Click Authorize to configure an Azure service connection. A new Azure service principal will be created and added to the Contributor role, having access to all resources in the selected subscription.

data.name: LearnMoreTextForAzureSubscriptionBasedKubernetesEndpoint
data.value:
For an RBAC enabled cluster, the service account is created in the chosen namespace and has permissions only on that namespace.

For an RBAC disabled cluster, though the service account is created in the chosen namespace, it has permissions across all namespaces (cluster-wide).

Learn more about Kubernetes
